title: Effiong Okon
text:
Effiong Okon (born 22 May 1985) is a <a href="Boxing">boxer</a> from <a href="Nigeria">Nigeria</a>, who participated in the <a href="Boxing%20at%20the%202004%20Summer%20Olympics">2004 Summer Olympics</a> for his country. There he was outscored in the first round of the men's light flyweight (– 48 kg) division by <a href="Italy">Italy</a>'s <a href="Alfonso%20Pinto">Alfonso Pinto</a>.
Okon qualified for the 2004 Athens Games by ending up in second place at the <a href="2nd%20AIBA%20African%202004%20Olympic%20Qualifying%20Tournament">2nd AIBA African 2004 Olympic Qualifying Tournament</a> in <a href="Gaborone">Gaborone</a>, <a href="Botswana">Botswana</a>. In the final he was defeated by Madagascar's <a href="Lalaina%20Rabenarivo">Lalaina Rabenarivo</a>.
